723427f-a.text:
State Street, north from Bridge Street to Battery Place, showing the old "E1" spur upon same. This carries the Sixth and the Ninth Avenue Elevated Lines to South Ferry. On the left is Battery Park; on the right, the U. S. Custom House; and in the background, the early Washington Building. Behind the latter and facing Bowling Green, is the towering Cunard Building. Broadway begins at that point.
1905
George L. Balgue
723427f-a.folder: State Street & Bridge Street, Manhattan, NY

722481f-a.text:
Pearl Street, south side, east from but not including State, to and inclding Whitehall Streets. (Pearl Street, runs east and west from
State Street, to Coenties Slip).
August 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
722481f-a.folder: Pearl Street & State Street, Manhattan, NY

723428f-b.text:
(1)
16 to 19 State Street, east side, between Bridge Street and Bowling Green, showing in the foreground, a portion of Battery Park. The house on the extreme left, is the rear of No. 7 Bowling Green, at the S.E. corner of State Street. These houses have long since been demolished, and on its sitenow (1937), stands the United States Custom House.
About 1861.
Brown Brothers.
(2)
The same, at a later date and showing demolition. On the left appears the rears of houses that face on Bowling Green. Note the Produce Exchange
in the background.
Date----f
Eugene E. Armbruster Collection.
723428f-b.folder: State Street & Bridge Street, Manhattan, NY

723425f-b.text:
(1)
State Street, at Pearl Street and viewing northwestward towards the North (Hudson) River to show the Whitehall Buildings. On the left is Battery Park and the ticket booth of the S.I. ferry. To the right appears the curved front of the Chesebroungh Building, No. 15-19 State Street at the S.E.corner of Pearl Street. Note that this thoroughfare veers northwards from this point.
July 4, 1937
P.L.Sperr
(2)
State Street, after "L" demolition, showing the Whitehall Down Town Athletic Club and United Fruit Company Buildings.
P. L. Sperr  May 4, 1941
(3)
State Street near Pearl after "L," demolition, showing Whitehall Building, Down Town Athletic Building and United Fruit
Company Buildings.
P. L. Sperr  January 8, 1941
723425f-b.folder: State Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY
